name: Ensure NonANSILeftOuterJoinSyntax *= operator is not used
description: Azure SQL Database no longer supports non-ANSI join syntax, specifically the legacy *= operator used for left outer joins. Queries using this old syntax will fail during execution in Azure SQL Database. This affects any T-SQL statements that rely on implicit or non-standard join expressions.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: Non-ANSI join syntax, such as the *= operator for left outer joins, has been deprecated for years in favor of the ANSI SQL JOIN syntax, which is clearer, more maintainable, and standard across platforms. Azure SQL Database enforces the use of ANSI-compliant syntax to ensure consistency, compatibility, and better query optimization. Relying on deprecated styles increases the risk of runtime failures and hampers modernization efforts.
remediation:
To ensure compatibility with Azure SQL Database:

Replace all non-ANSI join expressions (e.g., *= for left joins) with standard LEFT OUTER JOIN clauses.

Refactor affected queries to use the JOIN ... ON pattern for clarity and correctness.

Validate that the updated queries return the expected results, especially in complex join scenarios.
remediationSample:
-- ANSI-compliant left outer join syntax

SELECT A.CustomerID, B.OrderID
FROM Customers A
LEFT OUTER JOIN Orders B
ON A.CustomerID = B.CustomerID;

This modern syntax is fully supported in Azure SQL Database and improves both readability and compatibility.
sample:
-- Using non-ANSI left outer join syntax (unsupported in Azure SQL Database)

SELECT A.CustomerID, B.OrderID
FROM Customers A, Orders B
WHERE A.CustomerID *= B.CustomerID;

This query will fail in Azure SQL Database due to use of the *= operator.
